ray.rml

Interface Normalizable<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type that supports normalization.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Quaternion, Vector<V>, Vector2, Vector3, Vector4
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Quaternionf, Vector2f, Vector3f, Vector4f

    interface Normalizable<T>
    A normalizable object is one that can be normalized.

    Types that can be normalized include vectors and quaternions. Since calculating the length (or magnitude) of an instance is necessary to normalize it, these methods are also included in this interface.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isZeroLength()
      Determines whether this instance has a length of zero or not.
      float length()
      Returns the measured length (or magnitude) of this instance.
      float lengthSquared()
      Returns the measured length of this instance without taking the square root.
      T normalize()
      Returns a new normalized instance from this instance.

    • Method Detail

      • normalize

        T normalize()
        Returns a new normalized instance from this instance.

        Returns:
        A new normalized (unit-length) instance with a length of 1.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - If the length of this instance is zero.
        See Also:
        length(), lengthSquared()

      • length

        float length()
        Returns the measured length (or magnitude) of this instance.
        Returns:
        The length of this instance.
        See Also:
        lengthSquared()

      • lengthSquared

        float lengthSquared()
        Returns the measured length of this instance without taking the square root.

        This method is provided for performance reasons. It avoids expensive square root operations for simple comparisons (e.g. sorting).

        Returns:
        The squared length of this instance.
        See Also:
        length()

      • isZeroLength

        boolean isZeroLength()
        Determines whether this instance has a length of zero or not.

        Zero-length instances should avoid calling normalize(). Doing so will result in an attempt to divide by zero.

        Returns:
        True if this instance is zero-length. False otherwise.
        See Also:
        length(), lengthSquared()
